briefdescription.para: initial value. Tx has not yet been rejected
inputs (covered by txid) failed policy rules
otherwise didn't meet our local policy rules
transaction was missing some of its inputs
transaction spends a coinbase too early, or violates locktime/sequence locks

detaileddescription.para: Transaction might have a witness prior to SegWit activation, or witness may have been malleated (which includes non-standard witnesses).

Tx already in mempool or conflicts with a tx in the chain (if it conflicts with another tx in mempool, we use MEMPOOL_POLICY as it failed to reach the RBF threshold) Currently this is only used if the transaction already exists in the mempool or on chain.

briefdescription.para: this node does not have a mempool so can't validate the transaction
fails some policy, but might be acceptable if submitted in a (different) package
transaction was not validated because package failed

detaileddescription.para: A "reason" why a transaction was invalid, suitable for determining whether the provider of the transaction should be banned/ignored/disconnected/etc.

briefdescription.para: initial value. Block has not yet been rejected
invalid by consensus rules (excluding any below reasons)
this block was cached as being invalid and we didn't store the reason why
invalid proof of work or time too old
the block's data didn't match the data committed to by the PoW
We don't have the previous block the checked one is built on.
A block this one builds on is invalid.
block timestamp was > 2 hours in the future (or our clock is bad)
the block header may be on a too-little-work chain

detaileddescription.para: A "reason" why a block was invalid, suitable for determining whether the provider of the block should be banned/ignored/disconnected/etc. These are much more granular than the rejection codes, which may be more useful for some other use-cases.
Index marker for when no witness commitment is present in a coinbase transaction.
Minimum size of a witness commitment structure. Defined in BIP 141.
Compute at which vout of the block's coinbase transaction the witness commitment occurs, or -1 if not found
